results.title: The Rail way
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Don Murray, Department of Transport and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A look at railways in Australia from Alice Springs to Kalgoorlie and Normanton. Shows trains serving the mining fields in central Queensland and the suburban trains of the big cities. Discusses problems brought about by different gauges throughout the country, and looks at the economic future of railways. Commentator Patsy Adam-Smith.

results.creator_credit: R.J. Edwards, Australian National Film Board and Department of the Interior
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Shows the survey vessel H.M.A.S. Moresby at work and the training of paratroops; William Ricketts, the well-known sculptor; the Sesqui-centennial celebrations at Bathurst, N.S.W.

results.title: The Apprentice
results.creator_credit: Alan Harkness, Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Fontana Films
results.brief_description: Answers the questions of potential apprentices and their parents about how the apprenticeship scheme works in Australian industry by concentrating on Robert, an apprentice fitter and turner with an automotive firm. Robert, his father and his supervisor give their views on the training involved, which is intended to develop a boy’s character as well as to produce a good craftsman.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 028. Sydney Opera House
results.brief_description: Joern Utzon’s design for the Sydney Opera House is taking form in this newsreel program. The main concert hall with a 2,800 seating capacity, various drama theatres, rehearsal rooms, restaurants and other amenities are part of this exceptional building.
results.description: Joern Utzon’s design for the Sydney Opera House is taking form in this newsreel program. The main concert hall with a 2,800 seating capacity, various drama theatres, rehearsal rooms, restaurants and other amenities are part of this exceptional building.

results.title: Health is their business
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The manufacture of drugs, particularly “biologicals” at the Commonwealth Serum Laboratories. Since the laboratories were established in 1916 they have maintained a steady supply of vaccines and drugs which have reduced the child death rate enormously - almost eliminating many diseases [sic]. The production of Salk vaccine and penicillin is shown, the rigid series of tests on each batch of doses, and the extraction of spider venom for research on an anti-venene.
results.creator_credit_for_label: W. H. Shepherd, Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Case for books
results.creator_credit: Henry Lewes, Rhonda Small, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Library services in Australia. Shows briefly some of the work of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Library, the National Library with its varied resources, and examples of State, University, special and public services suggesting their value in meeting needs for information at all levels.

results.title: The Car ahead
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Demonstrates the reaction time between a signal to brake and the application of the brake by the driver. Advises on precautions to be taken when following another vehicle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: A Man's life is his own affair
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Gil Brealey, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personnel or People”.
An office-worker participates in a demonstration and his face is recognised by management in a front page newspaper photograph. Deals with the responsibilities of an employee towards his employer versus his rights as a citizen. Is a man free to do as he pleases outside working hours provided that it does not adversely affect his work?

results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Commonwealth Department of Information
results.brief_description: This film of life in Australia in 1948 looks at the Dental College in Sydney, sheep dog trials and the Port of Sydney. No other credits available.

results.title: Oranges and lemons
results.creator_credit: Margot Lethlean and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: A documentary on the early education of aboriginal children. It looks at a special pre-school program to help prepare aboriginal children for school, which has been set up in Dareton, Victoria. It suggests that in the face of insensitive attitudes, conventional education will further undermine aboriginal culture.
